comments.comment_text: My film should have won best picture. What the hell man.
Nah man, my film was too good.
Grand Budapest Hotel was my masterpiece, you new guys need to bow down.

In an allegedly upwardly mobile society, 20K in debt is plenty to stop someone on an average salary from being able to have emergency savings, open retirement accounts, and/or save to purchase property. God forbid the kid also needs to buy a car coming out of school. Although the data in this study is important, the conclusion doesn't match up - one doesn't need 50K in debt to be underwater. One only needs to be coming from a lower middle class family with limited ability to continue to support young adults.

It would be interesting to look at base years of 1962 and 1972.  How have things changed since then, ie. in a generation? The base year of 1992 is well after the 'trickle down' years started.  It would be good to see figures from before that time.I think the situation now would look far worse.
Does this story mean that Elizabeth Warren and Harry Reid have to apologize for making political hay (and careers) out of straw men?
This company's stock prices are probably surging right now.
Interesting that sales were that high while the company was in such a downturn the year before. I'm amazed. Mydo fan for life.
This company's stock prices are probably surging right now.
Did you see me in Whiplash? I was super good.
Damnit man, I didn't win an Oscar. But what the hell, I had a blast at the Oscars anyway.
I hope you like my music.
I wish my brother won an Oscar. Oh well.
